title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 63.6 - Hours of sale
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 63.6 - Hours of sale

State Regulations

The Alcoholic Beverage Control Law does not require
wholesale premises and wineries to be closed at any time. However, a winery
licensee, a wholesale wine licensee and a wholesale liquor licensee having the
right to sell wine at retail may not sell such wine during the hours prohibited
by subdivision 14 of section
105
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, nor during the hours restricted by any rule duly promulgated by the respective
local board of the county in which the licensed premises are located, except
that a licensed winery shall be permitted to remain open for the purposes of
selling its products, in accordance with the provisions of subdivision 2 of
section
77
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, and/or conducting public tours of its winery on Sunday between the hours of
10:00 a.m. and midnight. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
63.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
